results.title: They all can work
results.creator_credit: Brian Pollard, Rex Tasker and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Natural Recovery Systems of Moncton, New Brunswick, is a recycling factory. The employees are efficient and conscientious. All are eligible for on-the-job training and an after-hours life-skills program. They are mentally and physically disabled, a resource of forgotten people. The film shows them on and off the job, learning new skills, and generally relaxing among themselves in the company cafeteria. Narrated by Joseph Rutten. (Award: New York.)

results.title: They're a weird mob
results.brief_description: ‘They’re a Weird Mob’ is about Sydney, Australia in 1965 - a sprawling, growing city of three million people - and what people! Easy going, down-to-earth and hilariously funny - a very weird mob. Into this city arrives innocent Italian migrant, Nino Culotta. The adventures of Nino fitting in with the ‘weird mob’, learning their ways and outlandish language are shown in this Australian comedy classic. The film was carefully marketed as an ‘Australian’ production, despite Powell’s presence as producer-director, his British director of photography, and a screenplay by his regular collaborator in England, Emeric Pressburger (using the pseudonym Richard Imrie). Based on the book by Nino Culotta (John O’Grady). Cast includes Walter Cohiari, Clare Dunne, Chips Rafferty, Ed Devereaux, John Meillion and Tony Bonner.

results.title: Crash zone
results.creator_credit: Disney Channel Australia and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description: The Crash Zone is the place where the five friends, Mike, Pi, Marcello, Bec and Ram go to test drive the games. Combining technological fact and fantasy with issues such as friendship, teamwork and loyalty, the series follows the exciting online and real-life adventures of the friends.

constellations_other.name: Television and creative constraint
constellations_other.description: Making art for the screen is dependent on time, resources, and infrastructure. Where technology could have posed a barrier, these television producers saw an opportunity, instead.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Disney Channel Australia and Australian Children’s Television Foundation
results.description: Television series aimed at pre and young teens about a group of kids who land the after-school job of their dreams, testing computer games. The Crash Zone is the place where the five friends, Mike, Pi, Marcello, Bec and Ram go to test drive the games created by Alexandra Davis, owner of the software company Catalyst, before they go on the market. Combining technological fact and fantasy with issues such as friendship, teamwork and loyalty, the series follows the exciting online and real-life adventures of the friends, who range in age from 11-16. Although aimed at 9 to 13 year olds, “Crash Zone” is thought provoking and appealing to all age levels and can be used to encourage discussion about cultural, social, philosophic and technological issues related to ‘new media’, information systems and the rights of individuals in a ‘networked world’. Teaching resources can be found at: http://www.actf.com.au/learning_centre_new/Learning_frameset.htm Accompanying website at: www.crashzone.tv

results.title: Crash zone. Vol. 6. Season 2. Eps 10-13
results.creator_credit: Steve Steve Jodrell, Julie McSwiney, Ray Boseley, David Swann, Bernadette O'Mahony, Disney Channel Australia and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Crash zone”.
Episode 10: Virgil the A.I. manifests himself within a robotic body and runs away from Catalyst. The kids must track him down before Alex finds out he’s gone. Episode 11: Army Intelligence raid the offices of Catalyst looking for Virgil. The team does all they can to save him from conscription. Episode 12: To her fury, Pi discovers her father is exploiting her on the Net to further his acting career and sets out to show him how she feels. Episode 13: When a game Ram has conquered on the Net turns out to be a scenario for a real-life kidnapping, the team must stop a band of criminals from adopting Ram’s strategy. Cast includes Paul Pantano, Cassandra Magrath, Nikolai Nikolaeff, Frances Wang, Damien Bodie, Nicki Wendt and Matthew Parkinson. Teaching resources can be found at: http://www.actf.com.au/learning_centre_new/Learning_frameset.htm Accompanying website at: www.crashzone.tv

results.title: Therese Desqueyroux
results.brief_description:
Therese, finding herself stifled by provincial life and a dull marriage, decides to poison her boring but inoffensive husband. Emanuelle Riva subtly portrays the psychological and physical deterioration of Therese, while director Franju succeeds in capturing the oppressiveness of the natural world around her. Awards: Venice Film Festival 1962: Best Actress for Emanuelle Riva.

Credits: Producer, Robert Vignon ; director, Georges Franju ; writers, Francois Mauriac, Claude Mauriac, Georges Franju ; photography, Christian Matras ; music, Maurice Jarre.
Cast: Emanuelle Riva, Philippe Noiret, Edith Scob, Renee Devillers, Helene Dieudonne, Jeanne Perez, Sami Frey, Jacques Monod, Lucien Nat, Richard Saint-Bris.

results.title: South Park Rally for PlayStation
results.creator_credit: Acclaim Entertainment Ltd and Tantalus Media
results.material_description: CD-ROM videogame. CD-ROM and manual in CD jewel case with insert
results.brief_description: Based on the popular TV series, this kart-tyle racing game includes many of the characters from the show’s first two seasons. These include series mainstays like Stan, Kyle, Eric and Kenny to more unique characters like Mr. Garrison, Dr. Mephesto, and Terrance and Phillip, which have to be unlocked. While racing, a player can pick up different coloured boxes with a set of randomised items that can be used to boost the player or hinder other players. Other competitive game modes include variations of tag, collecting special items and delivering objects before other players do. Series creators Matt Stone and Trey Parker were not involved in the development of the game, but did provide voice work for the characters.

results.title: Crash zone. Vol. 5. Season 2. Eps 06-09
results.creator_credit: Steve Steve Jodrell, Julie McSwiney, Ray Boseley, David Swann, Bernadette O'Mahony, Disney Channel Australia and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Crash zone”.
Episode 6: Marcello alienates himself from the team when he uses a ‘cheat’ website to help him beat Bec in the school essay contest. Episode 7: After Bec returns from a trip to Silicon Valley in the USA, her cocky too-cool-for-school attitude threatens the effectiveness of the team. Episode 8: Marcello’s latest scheme, a “virtual band”, takes off and he becomes, on paper at least, a millionaire. But has he really hit the big time? Episode 9: A famous hacker steals Alex’s new game. When Marcello realises the hacker is someone he knows he has to make a difficult decision. Cast includes Paul Pantano, Cassandra Magrath, Nikolai Nikolaeff, Frances Wang, Damien Bodie, Nicki Wendt and Matthew Parkinson. Teaching resources can be found at: http://www.actf.com.au/learning_centre_new/Learning_frameset.htm Accompanying website at: www.crashzone.tv

results.title: College Slam for Game Boy
results.creator_credit: Acclaim Entertainment Ltd and Torus Games
results.brief_description:
Part of the NBA Jam series of basketball games, College Slam allows the player to choose from 44 real college teams and take part in head-to-head games, tournaments, and season-long series in arcade-style two-on-two frenetic gameplay. Each side starts out by picking any two out of five players from a team to play with. During timeouts and half-time, the player has a choice to make substitutions. Making three baskets in a row without the other team scoring, powers the player up which makes it easier to score.

This points to the unrealistic nature of the game, where players can make full-court shots with relative ease, characters frequently jump higher than the net and may get struck by lightning during dunks. The game features customizable teams and players and fight songs from all the available teams.

results.title: Theremin: an electronic odyssey
results.creator_credit: Steven M Martin, Channel 4 and Kaga Bay Production
results.brief_description: The unbelievably true story of Professor Leon Theremin (1896-1993), creator of the theremin - an electronic musical instrument played by moving the hands near its two antennas. Living in New York, Theremin was celebrated for his invention before being kidnapped in the 1930s by Russian secret service agents. A Russian by birth, Theremin was tried for treason, and sent to a gulag or labour camp in Siberia. At the outset of World War II, Theremin’s talents became valuable to the Russians as an originator of surveillance devices - he went on to create the first ‘bug’, winning the Stalin Prize. The theremin, which predated the synthesiser in terms of electronic sound, can be heard on the Beach Boys classic “Good vibrations” and was also utilised in the soundtracks of “Spellbound” and “The Day the earth stood still”. Used extensively in science fiction, the sound of the theremin often denotes an altered state of mind. Clara Rockmore, a theremin virtuoso and close friend of the inventor, reminisces about her experiences, displaying her mastery on the instrument. Features an extensive interview with Theremin, just prior to his death, discussing his life and work. Other interviews include Todd Rundgren, Brian Wilson and Robert Moog. With occasional English subtitles.

results.title: Crash zone. Vol. 4. Season 2. Eps 01-05
results.creator_credit: Steve Steve Jodrell, Julie McSwiney, Ray Boseley, David Swann, Bernadette O'Mahony, Disney Channel Australia and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Crash zone”.
Episode 1: The second season of the series opens with Catalyst on the brink of financial ruin. The kids find an electronic solution to the company’s woes. Episode 2. An inventor brings radical 3-D classes to Catalyst and Alex and the team must select the perfect game for showcasing them to the world. Episode 3: The lure of a program that can order all the free stuff from the Net automatically inspires Marcello’s latest brainwave. Episode 4: The kids are torn between their principles and their allegiance to Alex when they go on strike for better conditions. Episode 5: Mike becomes drawn in to a violent game on the Net after he breaks up with Pi. Things get out of hand when ‘Damon’, an evil character from the game follows Mike into the real world. Cast includes Paul Pantano, Cassandra Magrath, Nikolai Nikolaeff, Frances Wang, Damien Bodie, Nicki Wendt and Matthew Parkinson. Teaching resources can be found at: http://www.actf.com.au/learning_centre_new/Learning_frameset.htm Accompanying website at: www.crashzone.tv
